sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Greek Gospel Lectionary (fragments)

p.supplied: This MS description is not part of the M. R. James catalogue. Description prepared by P. Easterling.

msDesc.p: Paper, 325 225 , ff. 16, 2 cols. to a page; 23 lines per col. Cent. xv
e.g. ff. 1, 4, 5, 9: pair of scales in a circle surmounted by a star.
Faded vermilion rubrication for initials at beginning of lessons and for decorated headpiece on f. 7r (the beginning of the sequence from Matthew).
There is one surviving signature on f. 15r (ιε=15); original foliation λβ-μα=32-41, then μδ=44, μη=48, νδ=54, ρ=100, ρια=111, ριζ=117.

msItem.ab: ff. 1r-6v daily lessons from John, from (part of) Sunday to Saturday of the last week before Pentecost
ff. 7r-10v Saturday and Sunday lessons from Matthew as far as 4th Sunday after Pentecost
f. 11r and 11v parts of same sequence for 7th Saturday and Sunday and 8th Saturday
f. 12r and 12v parts of same sequence for 11th Saturday and Sunday
f. 13r and 13v parts of same sequence for 16th Sunday and 17th Saturday, ending with cross-references to lessons from Matthew for 17th Saturday and John for 17th Sunday
f. 14r and 14v parts of lessons for Thursday in Holy Week
f. 15r and 15v part of first of 12 Gospels for Good Friday
f. 16r and 16v parts of 4th and 5th Gospels for Good Friday

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by CF, but not by a second person
